author: tersec
content: meh, not convinced re https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/issues/349 to begin with

author: tersec
content: researchers need to have more solid basis for comparison anyway than relying on the spec, need to understand/maybe instrument each client regardless

author: tersec
content: also, it's sampling anyway, if one truly wants to measure gossip propagation per se, it doesn't require multiple client software even

author: dapplion
content:
Some p2p snooper would void the need for "Add block_gossip SSE event #405", but I would like to properly spec the existing `block` event. Anyone against "Specify 'valid' condition for block SSE event #404" stating that the event should be emitted only after:

- valid state transition (super-set of gossip rules) + valid/syncing execution + DA checks

author: tersec
content: oh, no objections to specifying the existing `block` event more precisely

author: radekkapka
content: `execution_payload_value` returned from `produceBlockV3` should be expressed in Wei, right?

author: nflaig
content: Looks like only the headers have the description but both `execution_payload_value` and `consensus_block_value` should be in Wei. The PR  https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/400 to clarify this was just merged.
